meanings.definition: A mark or spot that spoils the appearance of something.
meanings.sent1: The small flemishes on the mirror were hard to clean.
meanings.sent2: She noticed a few flemishes on her dress after the party.
meanings.sent3: The flemishes on the cake made it look like a polka-dotted masterpiece.
meanings.sent4: The flemishes on the canvas added a unique touch to the painting.
meanings.sent5: The flemishes on the car were like tiny blemishes on a flawless surface.

meanings.definition: To spoil the appearance of something.
meanings.sent1: Rain can flemish the freshly painted walls if not protected.
meanings.sent2: Please be careful not to flemish the delicate artwork.
meanings.sent3: His attempt to fix the vase only managed to flemish it further.
meanings.sent4: The negative comments flemished her excitement about the project.
meanings.sent5: The gossip started to flemish the reputation of the new employee.
